content: <?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?> <!--PUBLISHED / EXTERNAL * * * PUBLISHED / EXTERNAL * * * PUBLISHED / EXTERNAL--><!--InPort FGDC XML Extract 1.0.0--><!--Extract Time: 2015-03-19 14:10 p.m. GMT-4--><!--Extracted From inport.nmfs.noaa.gov--><metadata xmlns:xs="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema"           xmlns:inport="http://inport.nmfs.noaa.gov/inport/schemas">    <idinfo><!-- datsetid: gov.noaa.nmfs.inport:17270--><citation>          <citeinfo>             <origin>Malecha, Pat </origin>             <pubdate/>             <title>AFSC/ABL: Juvenile rockfish habitat utilization</title>          </citeinfo>       </citation>       <descript>          <abstract>Juvenile rockfish were observed amongst coral, sponge, cobble, and gravel habitats. Rockfish utilized coral habitats more than any other, while gravel was the least utilized. Sponge and cobble habitat utilization was intermediate to coral and gravel. Predation of young-of-the-year rockfish by sculpin predators was greatest in gravel habitats and lowest in coral habitats.</abstract>          <purpose>This dataset contains information on juvenile rockfish habitat utilization</purpose>          <supplinf/>       </descript>       <timeperd>          <timeinfo>             <rngdates>                <begdate>200508</begdate>                <enddate>200903</enddate>             </rngdates>          </timeinfo>          <current>                                     ground condition                                 </current>       </timeperd>       <status>          <progress>Complete</progress>          <update>None planned</update>       </status>       <spdom>          <descgeog>Chatham Strait and Gulf of Alaska</descgeog>
